alert.note: Alert for Butte; Custer Co Plains; Fall River; Harding; Hermosa Foot Hills; Northern Meade Co Plains; Perkins; Rapid City; Southern Black Hills; Southern Foot Hills; Southern Meade Co Plains; Sturgis, Piedmont Foot Hills; Ziebach (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 05 at 8:09PM MDT until April 07 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Northwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 75 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Wyoming and northwestern, southwestern and the Black Hills of South Dakota. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Cheyenne River Reservation. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...The high winds may blow down large trees and damage roofs, small outbuildings, and signs. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Strong winds can cause blowing dust, reduced visibility, and flying debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected late tonight into Wednesday, mainly across northeast Wyoming and northwest South Dakota where an inch or two may accumulate. The combination of snowfall and areas of blowing snow may impact travel.
info.instruction: Persons outdoors should watch for flying or falling objects that may injure you. If you are driving, be prepared for sudden wind gusts that can cause you to lose control of your vehicle, especially on open stretches, or as you approach the crest of hills. Also be alert for debris or dust blowing across the road.
